events.name: Game Programming in Kodu Sep 10 at Tanjong Pagar CC (Free)
events.description:
Game Programming in Kodu
 
Date:      Saturday Sep 10
Time:     10:30am - 11:15am 
Fees:     Free 
Age:      7-12 years
  
Workshop Description  
Kodu lets kids create games on the PC and Xbox via a simple visual programming language. Kodu can be used to teach creativity, problem solving, storytelling, as well as programming. Anyone can use Kodu to make a game, young children as well as adults with no design or programming skills.
In this introductory workshop, kids will learn how to create their own Kodu world and make a simple game.

 
 

Please note:
We will be filming and taking photographs of the children during the workshop. By registering your children's attendance at this workshop, Parents/Guardians grant Saturday Kids a perpetual licence to use Students’ work, photographs or videos of the Student, and other materials for purposes such as publicising or promoting our workshops/events and the students’ accomplishments.
events.location: Tanjong Pagar Community Club (CC), 101 Cantonment Road, Singapore  089774

events.name: workshop 2 [Beginner]
events.description: Hey everyone, we'll be having a 4 weeks workshop (every Saturday) on the basics of web programming that covers HTML, CSS, PHP and Javascript. This programming workshop is meant for beginners who have zero experience and touch with any programming languages at all, and is interested to learn more about the web. Not only will you learn coding skills, you'll also learn essential programming concepts that will help build your core fundamentals and help you become a great programmer. Throughout the workshop lessons, you'll learn to build an eCommerce website and by the end of it, you'll have a fully fledged eCommerce site deployed on the web. All the workshops are free of charge (gratis). For the second lesson, we will be covering advanced CSS and basic PHP. Light refreshments and snacks will be provided. Timing 11AM to 4PM Venue Ngee Ann Polytechnic, LT 73C. Things To Bring • Laptop • Laptop Charger • Github Account (github.com) • Codeanywhere Account (Codeanywhere.com)
events.location: Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 535 Clementi Road, Singapore 599489

events.name: Introduction to HTML / CSS - Hackerschool
events.description:
Want to make a website, but found w3c's tutorials too boring? We'll teach you HTML and CSS from scratch. Come down to get hands-on experience in designing beautiful webpages, and walk away with a basic, personalized website. Remember to bring your own laptop!

NUSHackers will be conducting their first workshop in the hackerschool series, "Introduction to HTML and CSS", on 10th Sept, Saturday at i3 Auditorium, and the workshop is completely free. Anyone from any faculty is welcome.

This workshop is absolutely FREE! Sign up now at school.nushackers.org!
events.location: i3 Auditorium, National University of Singapore,

events.name: Videography Training for Volunteers
events.description:
Free workshop for Engineers.SG volunteers and member of the tech community interested in learning about recording meetups.

Agenda:
- Intro to Engineers.SG
- Basic elements of event recording
- Introduction to our setup
- Hands-on: assemble and teardown
- Post-production tips
- General steps taken after video is uploaded to YouTube

You do not need to prepare anything. All the gear will be made available.

Email miccheng@engineers.sg if you have any questions.

Join our Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1070735369629915/
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576
